Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pippin \Pip"pin\, n. [Probably fr. OE. pippin a seed, as being raised from the seed. See {Pip} a seed.] (Bot.) (a) An apple from a tree raised from the seed and not grafted; a seedling apple. (b) A name given to apples of several different kinds, as Newtown pippin, summer pippin, fall pippin, golden pippin. [1913 Webster]
We will eat a last year's pippin. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
{Normandy pippins}, sun-dried apples for winter use. [1913 Webster]
Pippin n : any of numerous superior eating apples with yellow or greenish yellow skin flushed with red
